page.title: 16A FAMILY IN GLYNDE
page.content: We visited a family with four sons to find out about life for children in Glynde. They have to go to school out of the village as there is no school in Glynde. They play cricket and swim at the swimming pool and as there are four of them they don't lack company. Their house belongs to Glynde Estates. It is five hundred and two years old and it is white weather boarded. It used to be a butcher's and the nails where the meat was hung are still there. Their next door neighbour is an elderly person who keeps iguanas and lizards as well as dogs and cats. She tames robins too and she had two two-headed lizards as well.
